content.description: Start just right of the seam matched on the lowest part of the slanting shelf. Climb up and right to a good rail and the top. The right side of the first boulder on your left when you cross the bridge.

Start with opposing sidepulls low on the arete. An awkward move or two leads to a juggy middle section and then a though provoking and intimidating top out. 
  
 Tall and scary, Enchanted is a Top 100 climb and a proud send.

The Enchanted boulder itself is on the right as you enter the Enchanted boulders, and is obvious as the tallest boulder you see.
Though the landing is flat, Enchanted is a true highball and requires a calm head, careful climbing, and a lot of pads and spotters.

From the start of Little Dragon, link left into Underminer's Daughter. Good moves on generally positive holds. Surprisingly pumpy given the diminutive size of the boulder.



On the Little Dragon boulder.

Ascend the steps in between The Giant's Bose and Enchanted. Continue ~20m uphill and then cut right above the Enchanted boulder. Weave through the talus, staying below a large fallen log, and the boulder will quickly come into view up to your left after ~40m.

Start on obvious holds down left of the large shelf. Work through the shelf and to the lip on crimps and pockets. Save a little summin' for the mantle!

Up the trail (and stairs) from the enchanted boulder and down through the ensuing scree field.
a few pads

Start with a sharp left side pull in a seam and a blocky right sidepull lower down. Pull on and throw for the lip with your left hand.



The first boulder on your left when you cross the bridge.

Start with your left hand on the blocky right hold of The Mirror Left and a fat pinch-block on the right. Throw for the lip with your right hand this time.



The first boulder on your left when you cross the bridge.

Starting as far left as possible, traverse right along the lip of the entire boulder to finish next to the curved cedar tree, same as for Butterfly Stitch.



The first boulder on your left when you cross the bridge.

Start using a left seam pocket and a low, right shelf edge. Make a powerful cross into a seam gaston and then continue to the lip.



The first boulder on your left when you cross the bridge.

Start crouching using two slopey holds, hit a left sidepull and then up to a good edge. Exit left of the funky curved cedar.



The first boulder on your left when you cross the bridge.

One of the coveted Top 100, Tai Fighter is a classic and is highly recommended.  
  
 Start matched on a shelf on the left side of the arete. Follow the arete to a fun top out, using a combination of crimps, pinches, slopers, and heel hooks.

Visible as a pointed prow from the bridge, the Tai Fighter boulder is approached by either following the trail around to the right over a short set of stairs, or by scrambling left and up from the bridge.
Though you are never very high above the ground, Tai Fighter can be a bit scary because of the hole above the start and the sloping boulder below you. Most will want about three pads, and perhaps a spotter.

Start seated under the arete using a slanted left shelf and a tight sidepull pocket in the crack. Head straight up the arete using interesting features.



On the Little Dragon boulder.

Ascend the steps in between The Giant's Bose and Enchanted. Continue ~20m uphill and then cut right above the Enchanted boulder. Weave through the talus, staying below a large fallen log, and the boulder will quickly come into view up to your left after ~40m.

Start using a high, slopey V-shaped pinch and edge just to the left. Prepare for some powerful slaps up the overhanging prow.



Directly underneath Tai Fighter. On your left and straight ahead once you cross the bridge.
Quiet, secluded, and surrounded by large moss covered trees, the Enchanted boulders are home to some Squamish classics such as Tai Fighter (V4) and the highball Enchanted (V4).
